duck: Commutator (electric) - A commutator is a rotary electrical switch in certain types of electric motors or electrical generators that periodically reverses the current direction between the rotor and the external circuit.

commutator definition: a series of bars or segments so connected to armature coils of a generator or motor that rotation of the armature will in conjunction with fixed brushes result in unidirectional current output in the case of a generator and in the reversal of the current into the coils in the case of a motor.
Anticommutativity - In mathematics, anticommutativity is the property of an operation that swapping the position of any two arguments negates the result.
Canonical commutation relation - In quantum mechanics, the canonical commutation relation is the fundamental relation between canonical conjugate quantities.

Derivation (abstract algebra) - In abstract algebra, a derivation is a function on an algebra which generalizes certain features of the derivative operator.

In mathematics, the commutator gives an indication of the extent to which a certain binary operation fails to be commutative.

wiki.text:
In mathematics, the 'commutator' gives an indication of the extent to which a
certain binary operation fails to be commutative. There are different
definitions used in group theory and ring theory.
wiki.title: commutator
